title: Infinity Q Investment Adviser Faces Securities Fraud Charges
sub_head: Federal prosecutors charged James Velissaris, the former chief investment officer, with securities fraud, wire fraud, lying to auditors and obstruction of justice
body:
Federal prosecutors charged James Velissaris, the former chief investment officer of Infinity Q Capital Management, on Thursday with securities fraud and obstruction of justice following the collapse of the roughly $3 billion investment firm.
The U.S. attorneyâ€™s office in Manhattan charged Mr. Velissaris with securities fraud, wire fraud, lying to auditors and obstruction of justice. He faces up to 20 years in prison on each count.
